sections.title: Syntax
sections.text_content:
Sprite.SetPosition (spriteID, x, y : int, 
    centered : boolean)

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: Moves the sprite specified by spriteID to the location specified by (x, y). If centered is true, then the sprite is centered on (x, y). Otherwise (x, y) specifies the lower-left corner of the sprite.
sections.text_content: Moves the sprite specified by spriteID to the location specified by (x, y). If centered is true, then the sprite is centered on (x, y). Otherwise (x, y) specifies the lower-left corner of the sprite.
sections.mdown_content: Moves the sprite specified by _spriteID_ to the location specified by (_x, y_). If _centered_ is **true**, then the sprite is centered on (_x, y_). Otherwise (_x, y_) specifies the lower-left corner of the sprite.

sections.title: Example
sections.text_content: See Sprite.Hide for an example of Sprite.SetPosition.

sections.title: Status
sections.raw_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling Sprite.SetPosition, not by calling SetPosition.
sections.text_content:
Exported qualified.
This means that you can only call the function by calling Sprite.SetPosition, not by calling SetPosition.
sections.mdown_content:
Exported qualified.

This means that you can only call the function by calling **Sprite.SetPosition**, not by calling **SetPosition**.
